title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (Keeping the people at rest) Not to value and employ men of superior ability is the way to keep the people from rivalry among themselves.

passages.zh: 不貴難得之貨，使民不為盜；
passages.en: Not to prize articles which are difficult to procure is the way to keep them from becoming thieves.
Not to show them what is likely to excite their desires is the way to keep their minds from disorder.

passages.zh: 是以聖人之治，虛其心，實其腹，弱其志，強其骨。
passages.en: Therefore the sage, in the exercise of his government, empties their minds, fills their bellies, weakens their wills, and strengthens their bones.
He constantly (tries to) keep them without knowledge and without desire.
And where there are those who have knowledge, to keep them from presuming to act (on it).
When there is this abstinence from action, good order is universal.
